item.title: Credit Card Fraud Detection
item.description: Project GitHub Repository Introduction In this project, we will develop classification systems for the detection of fraudulent credit card activity, using a dataset of credit card transactions provided on Kaggle. As most credit card transactions are genuine, this task will require us to work with a highly imbalanced dataset. Thus, to build a powerful classifier that is capable of detecting fraud, we will need to solve the issue of data imbalance, which will be a key consideration throughout this project.

item.title: House Prices - Advanced Regression Techniques
item.description: Project GitHub Repository Introduction In this project, we will tackle the Kaggle House Prices: Advanced Regression Techniques competition. The goal of this project is to develop a robust and powerful regression model to predict house sale prices given 79 features describing homes in Ames, Iowa. The objective is to achieve the highest validation accuracy possible, without peeking at the test data or allowing the test data to influence our methodology.

item.title: Classifying Optic Neuropathies with Random Forest
item.description: Project GitHub Repository Preface This post and accompanying GitHub repository present the abstract and full manuscript for my undergraduate research on the applications of machine learning algorithms to the classification of optic neuropathies. In this research, multiple blinded and experienced observers measured key morphological features of the retina from optical coherence tomography (OCT) scans. These metrics were then used as the features on which the models were trained. The goal of this experiment was to develop robust models that could accurately distinguish between eyes from three groups of participants: patients with non-arteritic ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION), open-angle glaucoma (OAG), and healthy controls.
